goal.name: avalon:dist-sign
goal.ant:echo:
======================================================================= Sorry, but it is not possible to automate the keysigning. You need to install GnuPG or OpenPGP yourself, get yourself a key, add it to the KEYS file in the root of the 'avalon' cvs module, commit the modified file, upload it to daedalus.apache.org:/www/www.apache.org/dist/avalon then sign the distributions you just built. Your commands might look somewhat like:
cd ${maven.build.dir}/distributions gpg --output ${maven.final.name}.zip.asc \ --detach-sig --armor ${maven.final.name}.zip
cd ${maven.build.dir} gpg --output ${maven.final.name}.jar.asc \ --detach-sig --armor ${maven.final.name}.jar
or something similar, repeated for each file you're going to distribute. If you're on linux/unix (or have cygwin), you might use
cd ${maven.build.dir}/distributions for i in *.zip; gpg --output $$i.asc \ --detach-sig --armor $$i done for i in *.gz; gpg --output $$i.asc \ --detach-sig --armor $$i done
cd ${maven.build.dir} for i in *.jar; gpg --output $$i.asc \ --detach-sig --armor $$i done
For more help, see
http://nagoya.apache.org/wiki/apachewiki.cgi?SigningReleases http://www.gnupg.org/gph/en/manual.html =======================================================================
